channel.title: Compiler fix
channel.description:
I'm not sure were this goes but anyways for all the people who need help with the client compiler for Project Insanity here is your fix Im guessing your compiler looks like this [code=java]@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\bin\javac.exe" Echo: Compile complete pause[/code] This is what mine did look like I was looking everywhere for the correct code My pI client folder looks like this [img]http://i1107.photobucket.com/albums/h381/raylaw1/Screenshot_1_zpsb5e4368c.png[/img] Her is how I fixed it [code=java]@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0/bin/javac" -cp lib/*; -d bin -sourcepath src src/*.java pause [/code]
[code=java]title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\bin\javac.exe" Echo: Compile complete pause[/code]
So what you want to do First remove the ".exe" From javac Then add this " -cp lib/*; -d bin -sourcepath src src/*.java" At the end of javac Yes I am noob and this will help some people good luck

item.title: Compiler fix

@asshole_rule wrote:

why use this when m.dog released his perfect compiler

ridiculous…

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler fix
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

RUNE-PK:

1. I do use a compiler

Lol? We know that. That’s why we told you that you’re better off using an IDE instead. Coding in notepad then compiling is a horrible way to do it, you don’t even get syntax highlighting unless you’re using Sublime Text or Notepad++, but even then you’re far less assisted as those text editing programs are oblivious to Java libraries to help you reference them.

RUNE-PK:

2. This is how I know it, so calm the Fuck down

Again, we obviously know that, people are going to post it the way they know things. It’s just that the way you posted it doesn’t necessarily cover for all computers. If you’re going to make a tutorial, why wouldn’t you want feedback to help make that tutorial viable for everyone? Seems reasonable to me.

Read full topic

RUNE-PK:

1. I do use a compiler 2. This is how I know it, so calm the Fuck down

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler fix
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:10, topic:542638”][quote author=xEthanx link=topic=661514.msg4422197#msg4422197 date=1398998140]

just do this…

@echo off Title Compiler javac.exe -cp lib/*; -d bin -sourcepath src src/*.java pause

Actually, for the third line all you need is:

I don’t know why people don’t just do that before they distribute the client, so it will work on any computer and any operating system no mattter where the file path of the compiler is.
[/quote]

Maybe because not everyone has set their environment variables. The best way to combat this whole problem is to jar the client.[/quote]
No shit. But that has nothing to do with this. He’s talking about a compiler, not a run.bat or anything.

And yeah I don’t know why you don’t just use an IDE.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler fix
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“xEthanx, post:9, topic:542638”][quote author=jummppy link=topic=661514.msg4421685#msg4421685 date=1398739276]
just do this…

@echo off Title Compiler javac.exe -cp lib/*; -d bin -sourcepath src src/*.java pause
[/quote]

Actually, for the third line all you need is:

I don’t know why people don’t just do that before they distribute the client, so it will work on any computer and any operating system no mattter where the file path of the compiler is.[/quote]

Maybe because not everyone has set their environment variables. The best way to combat this whole problem is to jar the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler fix
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Why don’t you just set Environment Variables and use:
javac - Compiler
java - run using java
javaw - run using javaw (for applets/jframes/etc)

item.title: Compiler fix
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

I’m not sure were this goes but anyways for all the people who need help with the client compiler for Project Insanity here is your fix

Im guessing your compiler looks like this

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\bin\javac.exe" Echo: Compile complete pause

This is what mine did look like I was looking everywhere for the correct code
My pI client folder looks like this

Her is how I fixed it

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0/bin/javac" -cp lib/*; -d bin -sourcepath src src/*.java pause

[code=java]title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\bin\javac.exe" Echo: Compile complete pause[/code]

So what you want to do

First remove the “.exe” From javac
Then add this

" -cp lib/; -d bin -sourcepath src src/.java" At the end of javac

Yes I am noob and this will help some people good luck

Read full topic
